DataElement.preferredName: Asparaginase Administered Delay Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Question to indicate whether administration of asparaginase to patient was delayed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An enzyme isolated from the bacterium Escherichia coli or the bacterium Erwinia carotovora with antileukemic activity. Asparaginase hydrolyzes L-asparagine to L-aspartic acid and ammonia in leukemic cells, resulting in the depletion of asparagine, inhibition of protein synthesis, cell cycle arrest in the G1 phase, and apoptosis in susceptible leukemic cell populations. Asparagine is critical to protein synthesis in leukemic cells; some leukemic cells cannot synthesize this amino acid de novo due to the absent or deficient expression of the enzyme asparagine synthase. The E. carotovora-derived form of asparaginase is typically reserved for cases of asparaginase hypersensitivity._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An enzyme isolated from the bacterium Escherichia coli or the bacterium Erwinia carotovora with antileukemic activity. Asparaginase hydrolyzes L-asparagine to L-aspartic acid and ammonia in leukemic cells, resulting in the depletion of asparagine, inhibition of protein synthesis, cell cycle arrest in the G1 phase, and apoptosis in susceptible leukemic cell populations. Asparagine is critical to protein synthesis in leukemic cells; some leukemic cells cannot synthesize this amino acid de novo due to the absent or deficient expression of the enzyme asparagine synthase. The E. carotovora-derived form of asparaginase is typically reserved for cases of asparaginase hypersensitivity.

Asparagine is critical to protein synthesis in leukemic cells; some leukemic cells cannot synthesize this amino acid de novo due to the absent or deficient expression of the enzyme asparagine synthase. The E. carotovora-derived form of asparaginase is typically reserved for cases of asparaginase hypersensitivity.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive asparaginase at a later date due to protocol defined dose modifications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 02
ReferenceDocuments.description: If no, did the patient receive PEGaspargase or start a 6-dose course of Erwinia asparaginase on day 29 due to protocol defined dose modifications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If no, did the patient receive PEGaspargase or start a 6-dose course of Erwinia asparaginase later in the cycle due to protocol defined dose modifications?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2024.2.16 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0003419. ak
